image.altText: A young girl with dark hair wearing a gold necklace and a dark coloured jacket stands in front of a white car, smiling

items.synopsis: The South Australian government says it will evaluate an opposition policy to incentivise P-platers to be more careful on the road, as the road toll climbs more rapidly than in a decade.

title.children: SA opposition announces young driver incentive plan

image.altText: Elisa, Adam and Annette standing in warehouse. Annette is holding the lead of a black Labrador guide dog

items.synopsis: A new initiative funded by the federal government is helping people living with disabilities and charities connect to reap the mutual benefits of volunteering.

title.children: Annette's volunteering led to a 'really wonderful, interesting life'

image.altText: An old coloured photo of moustached man with tattoos on arm, a white vest, painting a window bar white, looks up at camera.

items.synopsis: This man was officially last seen at an Adelaide train station in 1994. But his brother-in-law insists that's not the last he saw of him.

title.children: Steve Lockey had been missing for two years. Then his brother-in-law walked into an outback pub

image.altText: Firefighters work to extinguish a fire at a house on Russell Island in Queensland.

items.synopsis: Police believe the bodies belong to five young boys and their father reported missing as flames took hold of their home and neighbouring properties on Russell Island, near Brisbane.

title.children: Six bodies found in remains of house fire on Queensland's Russell Island, police say

image.altText: Balupalu Yunupingu explains the importance of the message stick before handing it over to Noel Pearson.

items.synopsis: The confidence of Yes campaigners at Garma can be difficult to fathom when looking at the hard numbers and trend lines that usually dictate political campaigns, writes David Speers.

title.children: The numbers can't be ignored. Yes is behind, and it's trying new angles to appeal to anyone still on the fence

image.altText: David Spears wearing a dark navy shirt sitting on a chair next to Anthony Albanese wearing a wide brimed hat

items.synopsis: Anthony Albanese tells ABC's Insiders program Indigenous Australians want constitutional recognition and he is not considering any other options if the referendum fails.

title.children: PM warns there will be no other constitutional recognition for Indigenous Australians if Voice fails

image.altText: Indigenous dancers perform during a bunggul.

items.synopsis: Bungguls are the main attraction at Garma Festival, in north-east Arnhem Land. But this year is the first festival without Gumatj trailblazer Yunupiŋu.

title.children: Bungguls are one of Australia's oldest ceremonies. So, what does it involve?

image.altText: Shane Drumgold holding a folder walking into ACAT.

items.synopsis: The ACT's attorney-general says Shane Drumgold's role as director of public prosecutions is "no longer tenable" and he has accepted his resignation after his handling last year of the investigation into Bruce Lehrmann.

title.children: ACT's top prosecutor resigns after Lehrmann inquiry accuses him of 'serious misconduct'

image.altText: A man stares out at raging floodwaters in a village.

items.synopsis: A magnitude 5.5 earthquake strikes eastern China as rain continued to pelt the north-eastern regions in the wake of Typhoon Doksuri, adding more pressure to the country's struggle to recover its economy from the COVID pandemic.

title.children: China's economic losses from natural disasters surge to billions, adding more pressure to struggling economy

image.altText: A senior man smiles as he stands in front of an old church building.

items.synopsis: Phil Johnson, 63, had never heard of the tiny South Australian town of Paruna when its former Methodist church came up for sale. On a whim, he decided to buy the 88-year-old church to make it his home.

title.children: How to buy your own home without a mortgage? For Phil, the answer was a $55k former church

image.altText: A close-up of a corporate pwc logo on a reflective glass building panel.

items.synopsis: Firms and advisers promoting tax exploitation schemes will face hundreds of millions of dollars in penalties as part of what the federal government is calling the biggest crackdown on tax adviser misconduct in Australian history.

title.children: PwC tax scandal prompts government to crack down on tax adviser misconduct

image.altText: A graphic illustration shows a woman sitting in front of a prison cell with her head on her knees

items.synopsis: The next frontier of Australia's concussion crisis isn't on the football field, but in homes across the country, where victims of domestic violence are sustaining brain injuries at staggering rates.

title.children: 'One more hit to my head and it would have been game over': The invisible crisis in homes around the country

image.altText: A sign that says Leongatha

items.synopsis: The homicide squad is investigating after three people died from poisoning after eating mushrooms at Leongatha in South Gippsland.

title.children: Three people dead from poisoning after eating mushrooms in Victoria's east

image.altText: A smiling man holds a smiling 6-month-old baby

items.synopsis: Baby Afraa survived 10 hours under the rubble after the deadly earthquake that hit Turkey and Syria six months ago killed her family.

title.children: Syrian baby born under earthquake rubble turns six months, happily surrounded by adoptive family

image.altText: People burn incense sticks before praying for the victims of the US 1945 atomic bombing.

items.synopsis: Japan marks the 78th anniversary of the US atomic bombing on Hiroshima, where its mayor urges the abolition of nuclear weapons and calls the Group of Seven leaders' notion of nuclear deterrence a "folly".

title.children: Japan marks 78th anniversary of US atomic bombing on Hiroshima, calls nuclear deterrence 'folly'

image.altText: People walk along the beach with a giant cloud of smoke behind them

items.synopsis: As Russia's war in Ukraine hits the 18 month mark, the Crimean Peninsula is becoming both a playground and a battleground again.

title.children: How did Crimea become both a playground and a battleground for Ukraine and Russia?

image.altText: A large group of young men in a park disperse and run away after a smoke bomb goes off in the background

items.synopsis: The online streamer drew thousands of his followers to New York's Union Square, many of them teenagers, with promises of giving away electronics, including a new PlayStation.

title.children: Social media influencer facing charges of inciting riot after thousands cause mayhem in NYC

image.altText: A woman poses in an outdoor area, with a caravan visible in the background.

items.synopsis: Researchers estimate 440,000 older households in Australia will be without suitable housing by 2031. A 56-year-old central Victorian woman is already experiencing the pain.

title.children: A caravan has been Suzi's saviour as organisations shine spotlight on housing for older Australians

image.altText: People standing up against a metal barricade, holding out national flags and a huge cross

items.synopsis: More than one million young people brave the sweltering heat to catch Pope Francis in Portugal and hundreds of thousands followed him on to Fatima.

title.children: Young pilgrims braved intense heat for Pope Francis' World Youth Day vigil

image.altText: Charlie Curnow yells in delight as teammates mob him

items.synopsis: Carlton produce an inspired second half performance to beat St Kilda and move to fifth place on the AFL ladder, while a hard-earned win over Fremantle in the west moves Brisbane up to second spot.

title.children: Blues storm home to crucial win over Saints, Lions hold their nerve against Freo to go second

image.altText: USA's Sophia Smith kicks a ball under pressure from Nathalie Björn of Sweden at the FIFA Women's World Cup.

items.synopsis: Two-time defending Women's World Cup champions USA are into a penalty shootout in the round of 16 against Sweden after going through 120 minutes without a goal in Melbourne/Naarm. Follow live.

title.children: USA and Sweden going to a penalty shootout in their World Cup knockout clash

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Oh wow, ramp up the tension a little bit more because we're off to a shoot out. The USA have had three of these in their World Cup history for a record of 2-1, their only defeat on spot kicks coming in the 2011 final against Japan, who they will meet next if they prevail here. Sweden have had one shoot out in World Cup history - they lost it to China in the 1995 quarter final. They also lost a shootout in the 2020 Olympic Games final.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Full time: Sweden 0-0 USA: We go to penalties

children.content: Oh wow, ramp up the tension a little bit more because we're off to a shoot out.
The USA have had three of these in their World Cup history for a record of 2-1, their only defeat on spot kicks coming in the 2011 final against Japan, who they will meet next if they prevail here.
Sweden have had one shoot out in World Cup history - they lost it to China in the 1995 quarter final.
They also lost a shootout in the 2020 Olympic Games final.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Still no breakthrough. Are the USA panicking a little as time ebbs away? I don't think so - they still look composed and committed to the process that has bought them so much success in this game. Sweden will feel they only need one chance - the amount they have had to defend tonight is, perversely, giving them confidence that they can snatch a winner, perhaps. We have 15 minutes to find out.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Half time (extra time): Sweden 0-0 USA

children.content: Are the USA panicking a little as time ebbs away?
I don't think so - they still look composed and committed to the process that has bought them so much success in this game.
Sweden will feel they only need one chance - the amount they have had to defend tonight is, perversely, giving them confidence that they can snatch a winner, perhaps.
We have 15 minutes to find out.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: It's taken something special from Zećira Mušović in the Sweden goal, but we are goalless and are heading to extra time. The defending champions have been by far the better side - overall the USA have had 59 per cent of the possession, managed 14 shots, six on target to Sweden's seven shots and one on target. What's it going to take for the USA to beat Zećira Mušović? We have 30 more minutes to find out.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Full time: Sweden 0-0 USA

children.content: Zećira Mušović in the Sweden goal, but we are goalless and are heading to extra time.
The defending champions have been by far the better side - overall the USA have had 59 per cent of the possession, managed 14 shots, six on target to Sweden's seven shots and one on target.
What's it going to take for the USA to beat Zećira Mušović?
We have 30 more minutes to find out.

image.altText: A man wearing a dark blue polo holds up a towel and an IV-fluid bag beside a fire truck.

items.synopsis: The United States' brutal heatwaves are particularly punishing in Arizona, where cacti are suddenly collapsing under extreme temperatures. But one city has found some creative ways to combat the heat.

title.children: Welcome to America's hottest city, where firefighters carry Gatorade and IV fluids on ice

image.altText: A man in a shirt and jacket sits at a wooden table and smiles for the camera.

items.synopsis: Victorian government MP Will Fowles has rejected assault allegations after he was made to quit the parliamentary Labor Party. Premier Daniel Andrews says the matter has been referred to police.

title.children: Victorian Labor MP denies assault allegations after being made to quit the party

image.altText: a queenslander, mid-rise and high-rise in a graphic

items.synopsis: You have to build up to stop building out. But can higher housing density bring about affordability?

title.children: It's one of Australia's fastest growing regions, but can we get past our 'fear of density' to house everyone?

image.altText: A close up shot of some lottery balls.

items.synopsis: You might have heard stories about lottery winners in the US losing a big chunk of their money to taxes. But what are the rules in Australia?

title.children: How much tax do you have to pay for lottery winnings? It depends on what you do with it

image.altText: Donald Trump, holding an umbrella in the rain, speaks to reporters at an airport.

items.synopsis: US prosecutors flagged a threatening social media post from Donald Trump in a late-night court filing, arguing that it suggests he might intimidate witnesses by improperly disclosing confidential evidence received from the government.

title.children: 'IF YOU GO AFTER ME, I'M COMING AFTER YOU!': Trump's social media post flagged by US prosecutors to judge

image.altText: A platypus on a riverbank

items.synopsis: An ecologist says she's surprised the elusive monotremes are surviving so close to residents and urban development.

title.children: Platypuses found in Sydney's Hills District for first time in 25 years

image.altText: A small bird with a reddish beak, black head and grey and white body walks in the sand.

items.synopsis: Exactly what the juvenile bird — dubbed T7 — was up to on his holiday on the NSW North Coast remains a mystery. But conservationists say its epic journey can teach us a lesson on how to better protect the species.

title.children: Scientists stumped by critically endangered hooded plover spotted 850km north of its usual habitat

image.altText: An older woman in a bright yellow jackett and blue beanie smiles at the camera.

items.synopsis: World-record-holder Caroline Campbell, who only started running in her fifties, credits the regular habit with her survival.

title.children: Caroline is running marathons and breaking world records at age 80

image.altText: aerial view of dead mangroves

items.synopsis: Environmental advocates have developed a detailed strategy to restore a polluted mangrove forest in Adelaide's north, and prevent future damage.

title.children: Strategic plan paves pathway to recovery for threatened St Kilda mangroves
